topics.body:
"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557efb6763687234d70014df#post_557efb6763687234d70014df
[bq="HJSDGCE"]I should read a book.

Said no one ever.[/bq]
You should read Flowers for Algernon, 1984, Catcher in the Rye, Gaia, The Laughing Man and so forth.


If there is anything that I have learned from these books it's that human beings are both the smallest divisible unit of the whole and the largest unit of a individual and that besides the individual and culture there's a third entity that uses memetic ideas to transfer ideology and principle with each unit that each unit in turn can process to come to a conclusion about or reject thereby in turn affecting the whole while affecting the unit in order to create the concept we know as "society" thereby allowing the passage of information and knowledge; this third self is neither a sole nor a macroscopic entity but rather a anarchistic mob mentality that both on the macroscopic and microscopic changes things.  The "self" you recognize as self is nothing more than a memetic idea that is capable of recognizing it's own individual unit given to it by the memetic transfer of knowledge and information into it's self; ironically even though this memetic transfer of information is vital for the individual units to function interest groups reject the transfer of information that they deem to be outside of their own memetic ideas of "comfort" while hypocritically spreading their own.

I was going to make it longer, but I think that was long enough to give a Tl:dr; version.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: 1984 is awesome, ive never been a huge book reader but that book along with Lord of the Flies, Rumble Fish and To Kill A Mockingbird are some of the few books id say that are worth going through even if you dont normally have the patience for books
